articles.description: Mr Fix-it to start as Wallabies turn attention to Cheika’s Argentina
articles.content:
Dave Rennie has resisted the temptation of playing James O’Connor at fullback, with the dependability of Reece Hodge rewarded.
Hodge, 27, who has inherited the title of Mr Fix-it from Adam Ashley-Cooper will wear the No.15 jersey against Argentina on... [3597 chars]

articles.title: Argentina plans to spend $664 mln on fighter jets, possibly from China or U.S.
articles.description: Argentina is in the midst of the severe economic crisis that was exacerbated by the coronavirus pandemic. The ministry said the financing for the planned acquisition of the jets was outlined in the 2022 budget proposal that will be voted on in congress, where the governing coalition has a majority, in the coming weeks.
articles.content: Argentina is looking at buying up to $664 million-worth of multipurpose fighter jets to safeguard its airspace, the Defense Ministry said in a statement on Tuesday. A source with knowledge of the negotiations told Reuters that planes from China, the ... [629 chars]

articles.title: Argentina to make $1.9 bln payment to IMF, chipping away at debt
articles.description: Argentina will make a nearly $1.9 billion capital payment to the International Monetary Fund on Wednesday, according to two government sources and official news agency Telam, as the ailing South American grains producer continues to pay down the $45 billion it owes the fund.

articles.title: UPDATE 2-Australia's Lake Resources teams up with clean tech firm Lilac to develop Argentina lithium project
articles.description: Australian lithium company Lake Resources NL and California-based Lilac Solutions said on Wednesday they are teaming up to jointly develop the Kachi Lithium Brine project in Argentina, sending Lake's shares rocketing more than 20% higher.

articles.title: Brazil And Argentina Tapped To Make MRNA Vaccines In Latin America
articles.description: BRASILIA: The Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) has selected two biomedical centers in Argentina and Brazil as regional hubs to develop and produce mRNA-based vaccines to fight COVID-19 in Latin America, the regional health agency said on Tuesday.
